gurmukhi: Jwlr qwl miRdMg aupMg rbwb lIey sur swj imlwvYN ]
transliteration: Dhaalar Taal Mridan Oupan Rabaab Looe Sur Saaj Milaavain||
translation: The tunes of various musical instruments like cymbals big and small, trumpet, kettledrum and Rabab are being made harmonies.

gurmukhi: ikMnr gMDRb gwn krY gin j`C Ap`Cr inrq idKwvYN ]54]
transliteration: Kinnar Gadadhrab Gadn Darai Gad(i) Jachchh Apachchhar Nirat Dikhaavain||54||
translation: Somewhere the Kinnars and Gandharvas are singing and somewhere the Ganas, Yakshas and Apsaras are dancing.54.

gurmukhi: sMKn kI Dun GMtn kI kir PUln kI brKw brKwvYN ]
transliteration: Sankhan Koo Dhoun Ghantan Koo Kar(i) Phoolan Koo Barkhaa Barkhaavain||
translation: With the sound of conches and gongs, they are causing the rain of flowers.

gurmukhi: AwrqI koit krY sur suMdr pyK purMdr ky bil jwvYN ]
transliteration: Aaratoo Kottee Darai Sur Soundar Pekh Purandar Ke Bal(i0 Jaavain||
translation: Millions of gods fully decorated, are performing aarti (circumambulation) and seeing Indra, they show intense devotion.

gurmukhi: dwniq d`Cn dY kY pRd`Cn Bwl mY kuMkm A`Cq lwvYN ]
transliteration: Daanat(i0 Dachchhan Dai Kai Pradachchhan Dhaal Mai Kounkam Achchat Laavain||
translation: Giving gifts and performing circumambulation around Indra, they are applying the frontal –mark of saffron and rice on their foreheads.

gurmukhi: hoq kulwhl dyv purI imil dyvn ky kuil mMgl gwvYN ]55]
transliteration: Hot Kulaahal Dev Puroo Mil(i) Devan Ke Kul(i) Mandal Gadvain||55||
translation: In all the city of gods, there is much excitement and the families of gods are singing songs of feliciations.55.

gurmukhi: AYsy cMf pRqwp qy dyvn biFE pRqwp ]
transliteration: Aise Channd Prataa- Te Devan Badhio Prataap||
translation: In this way, through the Glory of Chandi, the splendour of gods increased.

gurmukhi: qIn lok jY jY krY rrY nwm siq jwp ]56]
transliteration: Toon Lok Jai Jai Darai Darai Naam Sat(i) Jaap||56||
translation: All the there worlds are rejoicing and the sound of the recitation of True Name is being heard.56.

gurmukhi: iesI BwNiq so dyvqn rwj kIXo suKu mwn ]
transliteration: Isoo Bhaant(i) So Devtan Raaj Kooyo Soukh(u) Maan||
translation: The gods ruled comfortably like this.

gurmukhi: bhur suMB nYsuMB duie dYq bfy blvwn ]57]
transliteration: Bahur Sounbh Naisounbh Due Dait Bade Balvaan||57||
translation: But after some time, two mighty demons named Sumbh and Nisumbh appeared.57.

gurmukhi: ieMdR lok ky rwj ihq ciV Dwey niRp suMB ]
transliteration: Indra Lok Ke Raaj Hit Chad(i) Dhaae Nrip Sounbh||
translation: For conquering the kingdom of Indra, the king Sumbh came forward;

gurmukhi: sYnw cqurMgin rcI pwiek rQ hY kuMB ]58]
transliteration: Sainaa Chaturanad(i) Rachoo Paaik Rath Hai Kounbh||58||
translation: With his four types of army containing soldiers on foot, in chariots and on elephants.58.
